member.name: T:Amazon.EBS.Model.Block
member.summary: A block of data in an Amazon Elastic Block Store snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.Block.BlockIndex
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockIndex.
The block index.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.Block.BlockToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockToken.
The block token for the block index.

member.name: T:Amazon.EBS.Model.ChangedBlock
member.summary: A block of data in an Amazon Elastic Block Store snapshot that is different from another snapshot of the same volume/snapshot lineage.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ChangedBlock.BlockIndex
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockIndex.
The block index.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ChangedBlock.FirstBlockToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FirstBlockToken.
The block token for the block index of the FirstSnapshotId specified in the ListChangedBlocks operation. This value is absent if the first snapshot does not have the changed block that is on the second snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ChangedBlock.SecondBlockToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondBlockToken.
The block token for the block index of the SecondSnapshotId specified in the ListChangedBlocks operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.EBS.Model.GetSnapshotBlockRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetSnapshotBlock operation. Returns the data in a block in an Amazon Elastic Block Store snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.GetSnapshotBlockRequest.BlockIndex
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockIndex.
The block index of the block from which to get data.
Obtain the BlockIndex by running the ListChangedBlocks or ListSnapshotBlocks operations.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.GetSnapshotBlockRequest.BlockToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockToken.
The block token of the block from which to get data.
Obtain the BlockToken by running the ListChangedBlocks or ListSnapshotBlocks operations.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.GetSnapshotBlockRequest.SnapshotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotId.
The ID of the snapshot containing the block from which to get data.

member.name: T:Amazon.EBS.Model.GetSnapshotBlockResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetSnapshotBlock operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.GetSnapshotBlockResponse.BlockData
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockData.
The data content of the block.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.GetSnapshotBlockResponse.Checksum
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Checksum.
The checksum generated for the block, which is Base64 encoded.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.GetSnapshotBlockResponse.ChecksumAlgorithm
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChecksumAlgorithm.
The algorithm used to generate the checksum for the block, such as SHA256.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.GetSnapshotBlockResponse.DataLength
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataLength.
The size of the data in the block.

member.name: M:Amazon.EBS.Model.GetSnapshotBlockResponse.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of all managed and unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListChangedBlocksRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListChangedBlocks operation. Returns the block indexes and block tokens for blocks that are different between two Amazon Elastic Block Store snapshots of the same volume/snapshot lineage.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListChangedBlocksRequest.FirstSnapshotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FirstSnapshotId.
The ID of the first snapshot to use for the comparison.
The FirstSnapshotID parameter must be specified with a SecondSnapshotId parameter; otherwise, an error occurs.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListChangedBlocksRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The number of results to return.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListChangedBlocksRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token to request the next page of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListChangedBlocksRequest.SecondSnapshotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecondSnapshotId.
The ID of the second snapshot to use for the comparison.
The SecondSnapshotId parameter must be specified with a FirstSnapshotID parameter; otherwise, an error occurs.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListChangedBlocksRequest.StartingBlockIndex
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartingBlockIndex.
The block index from which the comparison should start.
The list in the response will start from this block index or the next valid block index in the snapshots.

member.name: T:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListChangedBlocksResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListChangedBlocks operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListChangedBlocksResponse.BlockSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockSize.
The size of the block.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListChangedBlocksResponse.ChangedBlocks
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ChangedBlocks.
An array of objects containing information about the changed blocks.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListChangedBlocksResponse.ExpiryTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpiryTime.
The time when the BlockToken expires.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListChangedBlocksResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListChangedBlocksResponse.VolumeSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VolumeSize.
The size of the volume in GB.

member.name: T:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListSnapshotBlocksRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListSnapshotBlocks operation. Returns the block indexes and block tokens for blocks in an Amazon Elastic Block Store snapshot.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListSnapshotBlocksRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The number of results to return.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListSnapshotBlocksRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token to request the next page of results.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListSnapshotBlocksRequest.SnapshotId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SnapshotId.
The ID of the snapshot from which to get block indexes and block tokens.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListSnapshotBlocksRequest.StartingBlockIndex
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartingBlockIndex.
The block index from which the list should start. The list in the response will start from this block index or the next valid block index in the snapshot.

member.name: T:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListSnapshotBlocksResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListSnapshotBlocks operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListSnapshotBlocksResponse.Blocks
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Blocks.
An array of objects containing information about the blocks.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListSnapshotBlocksResponse.BlockSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockSize.
The size of the block.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListSnapshotBlocksResponse.ExpiryTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExpiryTime.
The time when the BlockToken expires.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListSnapshotBlocksResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.

member.name: P:Amazon.EBS.Model.ListSnapshotBlocksResponse.VolumeSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VolumeSize.
The size of the volume in GB.

member.name: T:Amazon.EBS.AmazonEBSClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing EBS
You can use the Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) direct APIs to directly read the data on your EBS snapshots, and identify the difference between two snapshots. You can view the details of blocks in an EBS snapshot, compare the block difference between two snapshots, and directly access the data in a snapshot. If you’re an independent software vendor (ISV) who offers backup services for EBS, the EBS direct APIs make it easier and more cost-effective to track incremental changes on your EBS volumes via EBS snapshots. This can be done without having to create new volumes from EBS snapshots.
This API reference provides detailed information about the actions, data types, parameters, and errors of the EBS direct APIs. For more information about the elements that make up the EBS direct APIs, and examples of how to use them effectively, see Accessing the Contents of an EBS Snapshot in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide. For more information about the supported AWS Regions, endpoints, and service quotas for the EBS direct APIs, see Amazon Elastic Block Store Endpoints and Quotas in the AWS General Reference.

member.name: M:Amazon.EBS.AmazonEBSClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonEBSClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.EBS.AmazonEBSClient.#ctor(Amazon.RegionEndpoint)
member.summary:

member.summary: Returns the data in a block in an Amazon Elastic Block Store snapshot.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the GetSnapshotBlock service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the GetSnapshotBlock service method, as returned by EBS.
member.exception: The specified resource does not exist.

member.seealso: REST API Reference for GetSnapshotBlock Operation

member.name: T:Amazon.EBS.IAmazonEBS
member.summary:
Interface for accessing EBS
You can use the Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) direct APIs to directly read the data on your EBS snapshots, and identify the difference between two snapshots. You can view the details of blocks in an EBS snapshot, compare the block difference between two snapshots, and directly access the data in a snapshot. If you’re an independent software vendor (ISV) who offers backup services for EBS, the EBS direct APIs make it easier and more cost-effective to track incremental changes on your EBS volumes via EBS snapshots. This can be done without having to create new volumes from EBS snapshots.
This API reference provides detailed information about the actions, data types, parameters, and errors of the EBS direct APIs. For more information about the elements that make up the EBS direct APIs, and examples of how to use them effectively, see Accessing the Contents of an EBS Snapshot in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide. For more information about the supported AWS Regions, endpoints, and service quotas for the EBS direct APIs, see Amazon Elastic Block Store Endpoints and Quotas in the AWS General Reference.

member.summary: Returns the data in a block in an Amazon Elastic Block Store snapshot.
